The Fundraiser

Posted Nov 6, 2010

Raising money for a non-profit is very, very hard work. We live in a world where the economy is governed by transactions. People give something, they get something in return. Usually this involves the exchange of goods, services, or currency.Asking people to donate money while getting nothing tangible in return, then, seems counter to what we expect. It doesn't feel right. And since we all have this feeling to some degree, even people working for...

Simple: ask.A study found that, after booking each reservation, if the...

The "Me Me" Newspaper

Posted Oct 28, 2010

In my experience, most companies that use blogs to promote themselves are getting it wrong. The reason is simple: try to imagine reading a newspaper where all the articles are written about what's happening at that newspaper's headquarters. Would anyone read that?
